author: Paul Vieira
title: Canada Laments ‘Limited Progress’ in Nafta Talks - WSJ
text:
OTTAWA—The U.S. has exhibited little to no flexibility during talks to revise the North American Free Trade Agreement, resulting in “fairly limited progress,” Canada’s chief negotiator told a conference here Tuesday.
The comments from Steve Verheul, who’s leading the Canadian team at the talks, marked another day of pointed barbs between Ottawa and Washington on the trade front, underscoring growing tension between the two ahead of another round of talks scheduled for Mexico later this month.
...
